column2: Role & responsibilities  :    As the Creative Manager for Print Design, you will be responsible for overseeing the conceptualization, design, and production of fiction and non-fiction books targeting the educational and early literacy markets. You will lead a team of designers and collaborate closely with authors, editors, and other stakeholders to ensure that our publications meet the highest standards of creativity, innovation, and educational value. Key Responsibilities:  Develop and implement creative strategies for print design projects, ensuring alignment with company objectives and market trends.  Lead and mentor a team of designers, providing guidance and support throughout the design process. ??Collaborate with authors, editors, illustrators, photo researchers and other team members to conceptualize and execute compelling book designs that resonate with our target audience.  Oversee the production process, from initial concept to final delivery, ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget.  Maintain a keen understanding of industry best practices, emerging trends, and technological advancements in print design.  Cultivate and maintain a wide network of contacts within the design community, including designers, art directors, illustrators, and photo researchers.  Foster strong relationships with external vendors and suppliers to ensure the timely procurement of materials and services.  Manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing workload and resources to meet deadlines and deliverables.  Conduct regular reviews and evaluations of design projects to identify areas for improvement and implement corrective actions as needed.  Uphold the company's brand standards and design guidelines across all print materials, ensuring consistency and coherence. Qualifications:  Bachelor's degree in graphic design, visual arts, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).  Proven experience (5+ years) in print design, with a focus on book design for educational and early literacy markets.  Strong portfolio showcasing a diverse range of print design projects, including fiction and non-fiction books.  Proficiency in industry-standard design software, such as Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator).  Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a team.  Exceptional communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written.  Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage deadlines effectively.  Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with a wide range of stakeholders, including authors, editors, designers, and external vendors.  Deep knowledge of print production processes, including typography, layout, color theory, and prepress. Our Offerings for Employee Benefits ????????ealth Insurance for Employee+Spouse+Two Children +Parents ????????PA  For Employee ????????ybrid working ????????ompliance  PF and Gratuity

column2: We are looking for an experienced Creative Director to provide our creative team with guidance and ideas to launch new impressive projects. You will devise the concepts and strategies for a particular venture and will monitor its progress. You will be able to implement your creative vision and become the point of reference for any creative plan that wants to make its way to the customers.          The goal is to achieve the best possible outcome of our projects both visually and essentially to meet customer expectations and drive our sustainable growth.                  Objectives of this role                      Lead and review the work of the creative teams for all web, print, and digital marketing collateral.          Spearhead and manage content strategy for both small and large projects, harnessing brand design, copy, art, and digital technology.          Collaborate with the marketing department in developing marketing plans, analyzing results, and identifying opportunities                        Responsibilities                    Supervise a cross-functional team of graphic designers, copywriters, social-media experts and project managers in the strategic development of messaging and deliverables          Prioritize work and resources across engagements, based on short- and long-term needs, and develop schedules by collaborating with designers, copywriters, and production artists          Conduct brainstorming sessions with creative team, maintaining strategic thinking to develop innovative and actionable initiatives in a fiscally responsible manner          Review and approve art and copy developed by the team, ensuring that deliverables address marketing goals and challenges effectively          Produce fresh, innovative work that translates complex ideas into compelling print materials and digital experiences for sophisticated audiences          Oversee the presentation of final concepts, and obtain approvals for deliverables          Conceive and implement concepts, guidelines and strategies in various creative projects and oversee them to completion          Direct and motivate teams of art directors, illustrators, copywriters etc. to help them use their talents effectively          Lead brainstorming/creative sessions to generate ideas                      Requirements and skills              Required skills and qualifications                      More than three years of relevant experience as a creative director in an agency or corporate setting          Experience in creating marketing/advertising campaigns from developing the vision and messaging platform to overseeing production on time and within budget          Experience in creating integrated content across all marketing channels: digital, social media, paid media, mobile, offline, and print          Proven ability to develop successful concepts          Proficiency in leading a team of diverse, talented creatives          Strong creative vision, with an eye on business objectives                        Preferred skills and qualifications                      BSc/BA in advertising, fine art, design or relevant field; MSc/MA will be considered an asset          Experience as a copywriter, graphic designer, or production artist          Experience in project management, with a focus on creative direction          Proven experience as a creative director or in a similar creative role          Hand-on experience in creative process, marketing, graphic design and brand development          Excellent working knowledge of software such as Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign etc.          Outstanding leadership and organization skills          Exemplary interpersonal and analytical abilities

column2: Skill required:  Marketing Operations - Creative Design Designation:  Motion Design Specialist Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 7 to 11 years  What would you do? Seeking a skilled and experienced Motion Design Specialist to lead/support our creative team in crafting visually stunning and engaging motion graphics and animations. The ideal candidate will possess a strong portfolio showcasing their expertise in motion design across various platforms, including digital, social media, and broadcast with 8-10yrs of experience. As a Motion Designer, you will be responsible for producing best quality motion design videos and work on the entire motion design process, from concept development to final execution, ensuring high-quality deliverables that align with our brand vision and objectives. Role requires Digital Marketing Ads & Promotion creation/designCreative design is a process that uses digital and physical design tools and core design training to create comps and final art that bring creative concepts to life for marketing purposes. What are we looking for? Bachelor s degree in Graphic Design, Motion Design, Animation, or a related field. Proven experience (10 years) in motion design, with a strong portfolio showcasing expertise in creating dynamic and engaging motion graphics and animations. Proficiency in industry-standard software such as Adobe After Effects, Adobe Premiere Pro, Cinema 4D, or similar tools. Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and motivate a creative team. Strong project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks, manage deadlines, and allocate resources effectively.  Roles and Responsibilities:  1.Produce high quality motion designs for video projects as per client and creative lead instructions.2.Lead a team of motion designers, providing mentorship, guidance, and feedback to foster growth and development.3.Produce videos with best concept designs and brand guidelines to follow the campaign story.4.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including creative directors, graphic designers, and video producers, to conceptualize and execute compelling motion graphics and animations that effectively communicate our brand message and storytelling.5.Drive innovation and creativity by staying updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in motion design, integrating new techniques and tools into our workflow.6.Manage multiple projects simultaneously, establishing priorities, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure timely delivery of high-quality assets within budget constraints.7.Develop and maintain production pipelines, standards, and workflows to streamline the motion design process and optimize efficiency.8.Conduct regular reviews and quality checks to uphold design standards and ensure consistency across all deliverables.9.Collaborate with external vendors/agencies as needed, to ensure adherence to project requirements and timelines.10.Stay informed about project status, feedback, and revisions, facilitating clear communication and collaboration among team members and stakeholders.11.Provide leadership in problem-solving and decision-making, resolving issues and challenges that arise during the production process.12.Uphold a positive and collaborative work environment, fostering teamwork, creativity, and a culture of continuous improvement. Qualification Any Graduation

column2: We are seeking a Creative Art Director to join our team of talented designers. The Creative Art Director will be responsible for overseeing the creation of visual concepts and designs for a variety of projects, including print and digital media, branding, and marketing campaigns.                 ?         Responsibilities:                       Lead and manage a team of designers and collaborate with other departments, including account management, project management, and development, to create high-quality design solutions that meet clients needs.     Develop and execute creative concepts, designs, and layouts that effectively communicate clients messages and brand identity across various media platforms.     Ensure that designs adhere to clients brand guidelines and project requirements, and are consistent with industry standards and best practices.     Manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively to meet deadlines.     Stay up-to-date with industry trends and technologies, and make recommendations for implementing new tools and techniques to enhance the agencys design capabilities.               Requirements:           Bachelors degree in graphic design, visual communication, or a related field.     5+ years of experience in a creative role, with at least 2 years in a leadership position.     Strong conceptual thinking and design skills, with a portfolio demonstrating a range of creative projects.     Expertise in design software such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) and familiarity with digital design tools and technologies.     Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to provide constructive feedback and mentorship to team members.     Attention to detail and a commitment to quality in all aspects of design work.     Ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.           If you are a talented and passionate creative professional looking for an exciting opportunity to lead a team of designers and create innovative design solutions for clients, we encourage you to apply for the role of Creative Art Director at our design agency.     ?

column2: Skill required:Creative Services - Creative production and Graphics  Designation:Management Level - Team Lead/Consultant  Job Location:Mumbai  Qualifications:Any Graduation  Years of Experience:7 to 11 years  What would you do? Be a part of the Marketing Operations team that is leading the managed services arm of Accenture. We power our client's business through the integration of insights, data, and technology. We are focused on activating and scaling the best brand experiences, to deliver breakthrough marketing-led growth, cost-effectively, across all digital consumer touchpoints and channels. The value we bring to clients boosts their marketing efficiency and effectiveness that powers their growth. We're looking to hire passionate and innovative leaders in Marketing Operations with deep domain expertise in digital marketing and delivering cutting edge marketing services across a range of clients and industries, bringing with them strong operations acumen and transformative leadership. The visual design and development team  is responsible for designing and planning the implementation of visual materials such as illustrations, photography, typography, space, layouts, and color. Visualizing and creating graphics including illustrations, logos, layouts and photos; shaping the visual aspects of websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions and more by using Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Corel draw.  What are we looking for? Adaptable and flexible  Ability to work well in a team  Written and verbal communication  Agility for quick learning  Detail orientation Roles and Responsibilities  In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems  May create new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures  The person would require understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals  Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor  May interact with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture  Guidance would be provided when determining methods and procedures on new assignments  Decisions made by you will often impact the team in which they reside  Individual would manage small teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture  Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts

column1: Head of Art ( Director / Associate Director )
column2: Title : Head of Art ( Director / Associate Director ) - Gaming Industry 1. Lead, manage, and inspire design teams, fostering creativity and innovation in the creation of 3D art assets. 2. Provide guidance, feedback, and mentorship to design team members, empowering them to reach their full potential and contribute to the success of the team. 3. Collaborate with the game development team to define art styles and visual requirements for new projects, ensuring alignment with the overall creative vision. 4. Oversee the creation of 3D models, textures, animations, and other assets, ensuring that they meet technical and aesthetic standards. 5. Utilize specialized skills in Maya, 3ds Max, Blender, Substance Painter, Vray, Autodesk 3ds Max, and other relevant software to produce high-quality art assets. 6. Develop and maintain art pipelines, tools, and processes to optimize workflow efficiency and asset quality. 7. Stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies in 3D art production, incorporating new techniques and tools as appropriate. 8. Work closely with other departments, including design, engineering, and production, to ensure seamless integration of art assets into the game engine. 9. Provide regular progress updates to senior management, highlighting achievements, challenges, and areas for improvement. 10. Foster a collaborative and inclusive team culture, encouraging creativity, innovation, and continuous learning among team members. 11. Lead by example, demonstrating a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and a commitment to excellence in all aspects of art production Educational Qualification / Work Experience & Skills : Bachelors degree in Art, Design, Animation, or related field. 12+yrs with Minimum of 5 years of experience in 3D Art Production for games, with at least 2 years in a leadership or management role. Proficiency in industry-standard 3D modelling and animation software, such as Maya, 3ds Max, Blender, or equivalent. Strong understanding of game development processes, including asset optimization, performance considerations, and platform requirements. Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively lead and motivate a team. Creative vision and artistic talent, with a keen eye for detail and a passion for creating immersive gaming experiences. Strong organizational and problem-solving abilities, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously. Experience working in the iGaming industry or a similar fast-paced, deadline-driven environment is a plus. Knowledge of shader programming, rigging, or other technical art skills is desirable but not required

column2: Role & responsibilities     Lead the visual identity and brand expression of the online ecommerce website, ensuring alignment with the overarching brand strategy.  Direct and guide the creation of compelling and cohesive art and graphics across various departments, including front-end design, photography, 3D graphics, and video production. Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure consistent brand representation and visual storytelling across all channels and touchpoints. Conceptualize and execute innovative and engaging visual campaigns, product launches, and promotions that resonate with the target audience and drive brand awareness and sales. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in ecommerce, design, and technology, and leverage this knowledge to continuously elevate the brand's visual identity and user experience. Provide mentorship and guidance to junior designers and team members, fostering a creative and collaborative work environment. Preferred candidate profile     Proven experience as an Art Director or similar role, preferably within the realm of Western ecommerce brands. A strong portfolio showcasing expertise in directing and leading art and graphics across various mediums, including web design, photography, 3D graphics, and video. In-depth knowledge of design principles, typography, color theory, and visual storytelling. Proficiency in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), as well as experience with 3D modeling/rendering software and video editing software Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and articulate creative vision and strategy. A proactive and solution-oriented mindset, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment while managing multiple projects simultaneously. Every minute you work is paid. How does brand success tie into the overall events strategy                              What are the regional events we should focus and execute and what is the design thinking to make each event successful                              What are the various other things that can aid brand success like monetization design critical to brand success, monetization product development and how it will aid self serve for brands                              The individual responsible for the role will also drive cross-functional alignment and will be responsible all events are aligned across all teams and are executed seamlessly                                    - Your work will be pivotal in ensuring the business achieves its top and bottom                              line targets. You will drive actions for each category to achieve goals such as                              GMV, Avg Sales Price, Conversion rates, Gross Margins and so on                                  - You will collaborate with closely with Finance, Procurement, Marketing, Product                              and City teams to influence their functions and drive business outcomes primarily focussing on brand success, brand JBP achievement and long term brand relationship                                  - You are a structured thinker and data driven. You possess the ability to link                              various sides of the business, understand correlation between metrics and call                              out risks and opportunities                                  - You will be involved in both the conceptualization as well as the execution phase of all critical initiatives, the expectation from you will be to own the day to execution of the program and ensure the success of the programs                                  - Since this is an execution focussed role at times you will be expected to understand the problem both analytically as well as understand the various levers that the problem can be broken into so that clear ownership can be assigned                                  Your Key KRA s                                  - Brand GMV and top-line growth, Brand conversion and events success                                  - Business profitability and GPPO (Gross Profit per order), Gross Margins and Discounts through successful brand relationships                                  What We re Looking For                                  - People with endless curiosity and hunger to learn                                  - Owners who will think of Zepto as their own venture                                  - Operators obsessed with the last bit of detail and willing to own end to end execution of mission critical programs                                  - Ability to manage senior stakeholders within Zepto to drive strategic goals

column2: A digital artist typically has a wide range of responsibilities, which can include:      Collaborating with other members of the creative team to develop concepts and designs   Creating concept art and storyboards to help visualize what a final product will look like   Creating 2D and 3D art using computer graphics software such as Adobe Photoshop and Maya to design characters, settings, and other elements for use in video games, animation, television shows, and movies   Reviewing scripts and developing storyboards for animation, infographics, and other visual media applications   Using computer software to create digital artwork such as illustrations, animations, or graphic designs   Creating concept art and illustrations for use in marketing materials or advertising campaigns   Working with directors, producers, actors, and other members of a film crew to create storyboards for movies, television shows, commercials, or video games   Designing illustrations or other artwork for printed materials such as magazines, brochures, or postcards   Creating 3D computer models and rendering images using specialized computer graphics software
column11: 3D, Usage, PDF, Computer graphics, Maya, Animation, Customer support, Photoshop, Advertising
